section.title: What is ocaml-gettext ?
section.para: Ocaml-gettext is a library to support string translation in OCaml. It provides a simple interface to help programmer's and translator to create programs that can support different languages. This permits the internationalization of programs.
The internationalization is provided following three point of view :

listitem.para: programmer : this library provide functions that can be used in OCaml,
translator : this library provides a standard file to help translator,
user : this library provides a set of command line options to set the language and the charset.

section.title: How is ocaml-gettext related to gettext ?
section.para: Ocaml-gettext is the nearby cousin of gettext. In fact, the API is based on gettext. Everything in ocaml-gettext is compatible with gettext :

listitem.para: the function provided in the API are very near to the gettext one,
the library contains a binding of the gettext library,
all the file outputed are gettext compatible : the library use PO file for translator and MO file for translation,
the library try to use the same initialization sequence as gettext : it uses the same environment variable, try to find MO file in the same place...
